name: olive tagine
ingredients: 1 large free-range chicken cut into pieces (or thighs)
150 g of green or pink pitted olives
About 20 cl of water or chicken broth
steps: Prepare the marinade: Chop the cilantro, parsley, and the preserved lemon peel. In a bowl, add the chicken with olive oil, ras el hanout, turmeric, chopped herbs, preserved lemon, and pepper. Let marinate.
In a pot or saut√© pan, heat olive oil and butter. Brown the chicken pieces. Remove them.
Add the chopped onions and garlic, crushed saffron, and ras el hanout. Let the onions soften for 10 minutes.
Add the chicken pieces, pour in the broth or water (up to halfway), and add the ginger. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes.
Add the olives (and potatoes if used) and the preserved lemon cut into cubes. Continue cooking for 30 minutes covered.
Serve hot, garnished with the remaining cilantro leaves.
